## Example: Generate a, b, c, and print the result(s)

The app link is here: https://ngduyhieu.shinyapps.io/solvingQuadEq

```{r}
set.seed(1234)
df <- data.frame(a = rnorm(1,0,1), b = rnorm(1,0,1), c = rnorm(1,0,1))
df
```

You want to solve the equation <font color="red"> [`r round(df$a,3)`] $x^2 +$ [`r round(df$b,3)`] $x +$ [`r round(df$c,3)`] $= 0$ </font>.

The hidden code can be found here: https://github.com/ngduyhieu/DevDataProd_Coursera

```{r echo = FALSE}
solFunc <- function(a,b,c){
    solFunc  <- as.numeric(c(99,0,0))
    if (a==0) {
        if (b==0) {
            if (c==0) {
                solFunc[1] <- 99 #The equation has infinite solutions
            } else{
                solFunc[1] <- 0 # The equation has no solution
            }
            
        } else{
            solFunc[1] <- 1 # The equation has one solution
        }
    } else{
        d <- b^2 - 4*a*c
        if (d<0){
            solFunc [1] <- 0 # The equation has no solution
        } else{
            if (d==0){
                solFunc[1] <- 1 # The equation has 1 solution
                solFunc[2] <- -b/(2*a)
            } else{
                solFunc[1] <- 2 # The equation has 1 solution
                solFunc[2] <- (-b-sqrt(d))/(2*a)
                solFunc[3] <- (-b+sqrt(d))/(2*a)
            }
        }
    }
    
    return(solFunc)
}

tmp <- solFunc(df$a, df$b, df$c)

if (tmp[1] ==0){
                print("The equation does not have real solution")
            }
            
            if (tmp[1] ==1){
                print("The equation has 1 real solution")

            }
            
            if (tmp[1] ==2){
                print("The equation has 2 real solutions")
            }
            
            if (tmp[1] ==99){
                print("Any number is a solution. 
                    The equation has infinite many real solutions")
            }

if (tmp[1] ==1){
                print("The solution is: ", round(tmp[2],3))
                
            }
            
            if (tmp[1] ==2){
                tmpPrint <- paste("The solutions are: ", round(tmp[2],4), "and ", round(tmp[3],4))
                print(tmpPrint)
            }
```
